title:
COVID-19, Prevention Teaching Tool (Odia and English)

କୋଭିଡ-୧୯, ବିଶ୍ୱବ୍ୟାପି ମହାମାରୀ
summary: COVID-19 prevention  booklet is for made for rural India  non commercial use (Odia and Englsih)

7.en: Odia & English Bilingual COVID-19 Preventive Teaching Tool

31.en: A pandemic disease caused by Corona virus started in China and spread to other countrires from there.  It came to India from these infected people who came to India from other countires, later they brought this disease unknowingly and spread it to others. Thus, Corona spread rapidly through infected people in different parts of India.Government of India is taking all necessary steps to face the challenge and threat posed by the growing pandemic of COVID-19 the Corona Virus with active support of the people of India. More than a lakh died around the world  due to COVID-19. But, If we are careful and keep hygienic habits, we can stay away from this disease and save others from infection.

43.en: Avoid touching your face, mouth, nose and eyes since COVID-19 could, in fact, be spread through your unwsahed hands. Keep your nails short and trim them often.

44.en: Avoid touching your face, mouth, nose and eyes since COVID-19 could, in fact, be spread through your unwsahed hands. Keep your nails short and trim them often.

49.en: If you cough or sneeze, cover your face with a handkerchief or cough or sneeze into your upper sleeve, not your hands.

50.en: If you cough or sneeze, cover your face with a handkerchief or cough or sneeze into your upper sleeve, not your hands.

54.en: When you speak to people, keep 6 feet distance.

55.en: When you speak to people, keep 6 feet distance.

60.en: Don’t give a handshake to known or unknown people. Keep a distance and do namaskar.

61.en: Don’t give a handshake to known or unknown people. Keep a distance and do namaskar.

65.en: Stay away from marketplaces where people gather in large numbers or any other places people gather and keep your physical distance.

66.en: Stay away from marketplaces where people gather in large numbers or any other places people gather and keep your physical distance.

80.en: People can catch COVID-19 from others who have the virus. The disease can spread from person to person through small droplets from the nose or mouth which are spread when a person with COVID-19 coughs or exhales. These droplets land on objects and surfaces around the person. Other people then catch COVID-19 by touching these objects or surfaces, then touching their eyes, nose or mouth.

81.en: People can catch COVID-19 from others who have the virus. The disease can spread from person to person through small droplets from the nose or mouth which are spread when a person with COVID-19 coughs or exhales. These droplets land on objects and surfaces around the person. Other people then catch COVID-19 by touching these objects or surfaces, then touching their eyes, nose or mouth.

88.en: If you go out of the house, make sure to wear a mask or tie a handkerchief to cover your face. Wash your mask and dry it every day. The cloth face cover is not a substitute for social distancing.

89.en: If you go out of the house, make sure to wear a mask or tie a handkerchief to cover your face. Wash your mask and dry it every day. The cloth face cover is not a substitute for social distancing.

94.en: Proper nutrition and hydration are vital. People who eat a well-balanced diet tend to be healthier with stronger immune systems and lower risk of chronic illnesses and infectious diseases like COVID-19. So you should eat a variety of fresh and unprocessed foods every day to get the vitamins, minerals, dietary fibre, protein and antioxidants your body needs. Drink enough water. It is advisable to soak fruits and vegetables in warm water that has one or two teaspoons of salt for twenty minutes or soak them with a solution of vinegar and water for 20 minutes.

95.en: Proper nutrition and hydration are vital. People who eat a well-balanced diet tend to be healthier with stronger immune systems and lower risk of chronic illnesses and infectious diseases like COVID-19. So you should eat a variety of fresh and unprocessed foods every day to get the vitamins, minerals, dietary fibre, protein and antioxidants your body needs. Drink enough water. It is advisable to soak fruits and vegetables in warm water that has one or two teaspoons of salt for twenty minutes or soak them with a solution of vinegar and water for 20 minutes.

98.en: If you are planning to go for labour work, look for government directives or ask people who know about the place whether it is safe for you to travel. But it is  better for you to stay in your village till govement declares for you to travel and do some work or business because many cities have gotten infected with the Corona virus, and many people are dying every day.

99.en: If you are planning to go for labour work, look for government directives or ask people who know about the place whether it is safe for you to travel. But it is  better for you to stay in your village till govement declares for you to travel and do some work or business because many cities have gotten infected with the Corona virus, and many people are dying every day.

100.en: 6. How can the spread of COVID-19 be slowed down or prevented? As with other respiratory infections like the flu or the common cold, public health measures are critical to slow the spread of illnesses. Public health measures are everyday preventive actions that include: ✓ staying home when sick; ✓ covering mouth and nose with flexed elbow or tissue when coughing or sneezing. Dispose of used tissue immediately; ✓ washing hands often with soap and water; and ✓ cleaning frequently touched surfaces and objects. As we learn more about COVID-19 public health officials may recommend additional actions. (Courtesy: https://www.unicef.org/india/)
